DataElement.preferredName: Fluorescence in Situ Hybridization Double Trisomy Positive Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The determination using FISH as to whether or not a case is positive for trisomy 4 & 10 (double trisomy, DT), using the following criteria: (1) must be positive for both trisomy 4 and trisomy 10, and (2) the percentage of one trisomy cannot be greater than or equal to 2X the percentage of the other.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Fluorescence in Situ Hybridization Double Trisomy Positive
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping._Consisting of or involving two parts or components, often in pairs._A chromosomal abnormality consisting of the presence of one chromosome in addition to the normal diploid number._That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison._Involving advantage or good.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A type of IN SITU HYBRIDIZATION in which target sequences are stained with fluorescent dye so their location and size can be determined using fluorescence microscopy. This staining is sufficiently distinct that the hybridization signal can be seen both in metaphase spreads and in interphase nuclei.

Concepts.definition: A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping.

Property.preferredDefinition: Consisting of or involving two parts or components, often in pairs.:A chromosomal abnormality consisting of the presence of one chromosome in addition to the normal diploid number.:Involving advantage or good.

Concepts.definition: Consisting of or involving two parts or components, often in pairs.
A chromosomal abnormality consisting of the presence of one chromosome in addition to the normal diploid number.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
